sentences.en: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.cn: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

sentences.en: A walkman can relieve the boredom of running.
sentences.cn: 跑步时带着随身听就不那么乏味了.

sentences.en: At seven o'clock the night nurse came in to relieve her.
sentences.cn: 7点钟的时候夜班护士来接她的班。

sentences.en: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
Massage is used to relax muscles, relieve stress and improve the circulation.
sentences.cn: 按摩可以使肌肉放松，缓解压力和促进血液循环。

sentences.en: Nose drops often relieve nasal congestion.
sentences.cn: 滴鼻剂常可缓解鼻腔充血.

sentences.en: Peppermint leaves are believed to relieve tiredness and nasal stuffiness.
sentences.cn: 据信薄荷叶可以减轻疲劳和鼻塞。

sentences.en: Robots can relieve people of dull and repetitive work.
sentences.cn: 单调重复的工作,机器人可以代劳.

sentences.en: She longed for something to relieve the tedium of everyday life.
sentences.cn: 她渴望有什么事情能排解她日常生活中的烦闷。

sentences.en: She watches television to relieve the monotony of everyday life.
sentences.cn: 她天天靠看电视来解闷儿。

sentences.en: The boy said he badly wanted to relieve himself.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩说他想上厕所.

sentences.en: The doctors did their best to relieve the patient.
sentences.cn: 医生们尽力减轻病人的痛苦.

sentences.en: The druggist suggested a preparation to relieve the ache.
sentences.cn: 药剂师建议配一种止痛剂.

sentences.en: These machines would relieve the peasants of their backbreaking labour.
sentences.cn: 这些机器可以把农民从繁重的体力劳动中解放出来.

sentences.en: They decided not to count on foreign aid to relieve the famine.
sentences.cn: 他们决定不依靠外援来救灾.

sentences.en: to relieve the symptoms of a cold

words.tran_cn: 解除，减轻；使不单调乏味；换…的班；解围；使放心

trans.tran_en: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

trans.tran_cn: 解除，缓解，换班，（去厕所的一种委婉说法）方便
trans.tran_en: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings
